Dumbarton House to Host First Citizenship Ceremony August 1

Dumbarton House will bethe host site for a citizenship ceremony for twenty-five children on August 1, 2014. This will be the first time Dumbarton House has hosted this type of event, and the museum hopes to make it an annual occurrence.

Carine's Bridal Atelier in Georgetown showcases the hottest designers of bridal fashion, offering unparalleled wedding gown expertise and tailoring to each client's body type, personality and destination.

Cold Case

“The Hunt” with John Walsh premiered on CNN on July 13th. On Sunday, July 26th the show closed in on one of Washington’s most baffling and disturbing cases: William Bradford Bishop, Jr. wanted for the murder of his wife, his mother, his three children.

'The Girls Of Real Estate' Join Beasley

Heidi Jerakis, Candace Moe, and Chelle Gassan have joined Beasley Real Estate, it has been announced.

Heidi has a decade of experience in real estate sales within the Commonwealth of Virginia and 12 years of corporate management.

Billie Holiday Musical Tribute at Blues Alley August 8 & 9

"A Brighter Side of Day" the tribute to Billie Holiday starring Kathy Sledge (Sister Sledge) is a musical journey of an American icon of her day who rose to become a social phenomenon in the 1950s.

Fifty egg tempera paintings by Caroline Adams are being exhibited at Susan Calloway Fine Arts Gallery from July 26 through August 30.

Tinos, It's Good For the Soul

After a week in Tinos, I feel like a new person. Someone healthier, more rested, calmer, someone with more breathing room. It may be all of the fresh Greek salads, and the swimming in the sea, but I think there is more to it… Tinos is good for my soul.

Coffee, Tea &: A Guide to Georgetown Favorites

Georgetown is a neighborhood ripe with unique boutiques and designer stores, but amidst all the shopping and bargaining, shoppers need to stop for a bite to eat and a cappuccino to sip! Read on for a breakdown of a few of the many coffee shops nestled in the hub of this city.

The Georgetown BID, in partnership with Georgetown yoga and pilates studios, will host free one-hour sunset yoga and pilates sessions in the park throughout the summer.

Jason Wright's Artwork: Another Good Reason to go to Rehoboth Beach

Having spent much time in Rehoboth Beach for the past thirty summers it’s not difficult to come up with reasons to go. But along with everything else Rehoboth is now a thriving Gallery scene representing not only local artists but many from across the nation.

July at Tudor Place

From a lively guided walk tracing the history and horticulture of centuries-old trees, heirloom plants and flowers across five-and-a-half-acres to Summer Fun in the Sun for Tots, Tudor Place is a great place to visit this month.

2014 Capital Fringe Festival Inside Look: The Tournament

All throughout July, the 2014 Capital Fringe Festival will overwhelm theaters across the district with a vast selection of unique plays. This annual festival features a myriad of plays from different companies and their talented casts.

Every five years, the Business Improvement District (BID) requests extension of the organization's term for another five years, pursuant to the DC Business Improvement District Act of 1996.

Turned down by American Idol? Gypsy Sally's Vinyl Lounge presents FREE Open Mic July 8th.

Doors open at 6:00 pm and show starts at 8:00 pm.

WFP Lists AIA Award-Winning Hugh Newell Jacobsen Masterpiece

Washington Fine Properties is pleased to announce the listing of an AIA award-winning Hugh Newell Jacobsen masterpiece! Georgetown-based Jacobsen was the National Winner of the 2012 Chrysalis Award (whole house remodel over $1 million) for this 1815 classic.

Fillmore Arts Camp: Consistent Dedication Across Generations

Since Monday June 23rd, the third floor of Hardy Middle School has played host to Fillmore Arts Summer Camp. A group of young children are divided into age appropriate groups and treated to a summer of improve classes, pottery creation, collage art and tie dye.
